stork.feather

Class Sink<R extends Resource>

  • java.lang.Object
    • stork.feather.PipeElement<R>
      • stork.feather.Sink<R>
  • Type Parameters:
    R - The destination Resource type.
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AggregatorSink, HexDumpSink

    public abstract class Sink<R extends Resource>
extends PipeElement<R>
    A Sink is a destination for Slices emitted by Taps. It is the Sink's responsibility to "drain" Slices to the associated physical resource (or other data consumer). Slices should be drained as soon as possible to, and be retained only if necessary.

    If a Slice cannot be drained immediately, the Sink should call pause() to prevent the attached Tap from emitting further Slices. Once a Slice is drained to the Sink, the Slice cannot be requested again, and it is the Sink's responsibility to guarantee that the Slice is eventually drained.

    See Also:
    Tap, Slice

    • Method Detail

      • attach

        public final <S> ProxyTransfer<S,R> attach(Tap<S> tap)
        Attach this Sink to a Tap. Once this method is called, PipeElement.start() will be called and the sink may begin draining data from the tap. This is equivalent to calling tap.attach(this).
        Parameters:
        tap - a Tap to attach.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if tap is null.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if a Tap has already been attached.

      • initialize

        public Bell<?> initialize(Relative<Resource> resource)
        This can be overridden by Sink implementations to initialize the transfer of Slices for a Resource.
        Specified by:
        initialize in class PipeElement<R extends Resource>
        Parameters:
        resource - the Resource which should be initialized, in a Relative wrapper.
        Returns:
        A Bell which will ring when data for resource is ready to be drained, or null if data can begin being drained immediately.

      • drain

        public abstract void drain(Relative<Slice> slice)
        Drain a Slice to the endpoint storage system. This method returns as soon as possible, with the actual I/O operation taking place asynchronously.

        If the Slice cannot be drained immeditately due to congestion, pause() should be called, and resume() should be called when the channel is free to transmit data again.

        Specified by:
        drain in class PipeElement<R extends Resource>
        Parameters:
        slice - a Slice being drained through the pipeline.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this method is called when the pipeline has not been initialized.

      • finalize

        public void finalize(Relative<Resource> resource)
        This can be overridden by Sink implementations to finalize the transfer of Slices for a Resource.
        Specified by:
        finalize in class PipeElement<R extends Resource>
        Parameters:
        resource - the Resource being finalized.

      • random

        public boolean random()
        Sink implementations can override this to handle initialization Exceptions from upstream. By default, this method will throw the Exception back to the transfer mediator.
        Specified by:
        random in class PipeElement<R extends Resource>
        Parameters:
        path - the path of the Resource which had an exception.
        Returns:
        true if transmitting slices in arbitrary order is supported.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if error was not handled.

      • concurrency

        public int concurrency()
        Description copied from class: PipeElement
        Get the number of distinct Resources the pipeline may be in the process of transferring simultaneously. Specifically, this value limits how many times #initialize(...) may be called before a corresponding #finalize(...) must be called to free up a transfer slot.

        Returning a number less than or equal to zero indicates that an arbitrary number of Resources may be transferred concurrently.

        Specified by:
        concurrency in class PipeElement<R extends Resource>
        Returns:
        The number of data Resources this sink can receive concurrently.

      • pause

        public final void pause()
        Called when an upstream tap encounters an error while downloading a Resource. Depending on the nature of the error, the sink should decide to either abort the transfer, omit the file, or take some other action.
        Specified by:
        pause in class PipeElement<R extends Resource>
        Parameters:
        error - the error that occurred during transfer, along with contextual information

      • resume

        public final void resume()
        Description copied from class: PipeElement
        Resume the transfer after a pause. Implementors should assume this method will only be called from a paused state.
        Specified by:
        resume in class PipeElement<R extends Resource>

        Get the root Resource of the attached Tap.
        Returns:
        The root Resource of the attached Tap.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if a tap has not been attached.
